moves.1. d4: So here's a game  played against stargate2 where at first i was getting completely destroyed but then managed to win the game by forcing my opponent to resign.
moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. e3 g6 4. c4: i maybe should have declined the gambit, but i was afraid white might push the pawn to c5, gaining alot of space.
moves.4... dxc4 5. d5: this was a odd move, i didn't really know how to respond.
moves.5... Nb4: and of course i chose the worst possible place to move my knight to.
moves.6... Qd7 7. Qxb4 Qxd5 8. Bxc4: and now he takes the gambit pawn back, and gains tempo at the same time.
moves.8... Qd6: i tried to get the queens off,to get a little break and develop in peace, without my queen being chased all the time.
moves.9. Qb3 Bg7: this was a blunder because i didn't pay attention to the pressure on f7.
moves.10. Bxf7+: another pawn lost, and I'm getting desperate.
moves.12... Qe7 13. Qd3: i could have taken the bishop, but I'm not sure why i didn't.
moves.13... Bf6 14. Bxg6: losing another pawn, and was thinking of resigning here.
moves.14... hxg6: why he sacrificed his bishop, i don't know.
moves.16. Qe4 Bd7: This was another bad move, just giving up the pawn. I don't really know what was i doing in this game.
moves.17. Qxb7 Qe8 18. Qxc7: another pawn lost, i actually clicked resign here, but decided not to confirm it yet.
moves.18... Bg5 19. Rxd7: bye bye bishop, here i just decided to get mated.
moves.19... Rd8: Here i knew the rook cannot move, because of back row check, and i decided to do everything i can to get the rook to move.
moves.20. Qc5+ Be7: This was a decent move on my behalf, because attacking the queen, and queen cannot take because 21..... qxe7, loses the queen.
moves.21. Rxe7: Here my opponent blundered badly, he bites the apparently "lose" bishop trap and i was reliefed to win this game.
moves.21... Rd1+: and here white resigns, this was a very very bad game on my behalf, but i got lucky at the end and managed to win the game with last ditch effort.
